comment: Professor Beach is awesome! She uses revel for this class & it's so clear & straight forward. She's understanding and doesn't make class more difficult than it needs to be. Weekly discussions but you're only required to do half (rest are extra credit). 2 test (final & midterm) which are the quiz questions or very similar. Recommend reading the TB!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Beach is incredibly sweet and has an easy A class. I didn't put any time into studying for this class and am definitely making an A. Her weekly assignments are on quizlet, and you can choose 5 activities to participate in throughout the semester (super easy).

This class was very easy. She is easy to contact. There is a midterm and final, the final is not cumulative. Every week you use Revel to do a reading and then do a quiz with each chapter, with optional stuff within them to help you grasp content. I 100% recommend it!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Like most online classes, it is divided into modules, usually with a quiz and/or discussion post at the end. Her classes are no different. She uses Revel for the textbook and quizzes, so the quizzes are directly from the textbook. Her class was pretty easy if you know the material, but most of the questions on quizzes were common knowledge.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I had this class online and she was the absolute best! She is super sweet and always answering her emails. Every week you have a discussion post and a very easy homework assignment. She always gives positive feedback and grading is very clear. You have two tests in the class and it is easy as well. Plus this topic is interesting to learn about!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Inspirational

comment: I had her as for an online class in communications and she was very clear in the syllabus what was going to be due when. Her class was very easy to navigate through and she is great with the assignments. Highly recommend taking her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Grade comes from work online from textbook, tests, and weekly choice board assignments (either class discussion post or worksheet activity). All test answers can be found on Quizlet. comment: The midterm and final are worth 80 percent of your grade (each is 40% apiece) just keep that in mind.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She gave a planner each week of what was due. You have to do 5 out of 12 discussion posts, and they were very straightforward. You would have to read the chapter in the book and follow along to take short quizzes after each section. The only few grades there were was the midterm, the final exam, quiz grades, and the discussion posts.

I had this class online because of Covid. Professor Beach wrote a weekly planner for us for the whole course. The assignments were easy and you only had to to a total of 5 out of 12. The tests were simple you just had to read the textbook and take notes. The tests also were open notes. She gave great feedback. Overall my favorite professor I had!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Prof Beach was great for the classes I had her for! She is an easy grader if you follow directions. She always responds to emails, & she really helped me become a better public speaker. comment: I took for 2 classes and I got B's in both. She probably as the same course plans and work from years ago when she started teaching the classes. Group actives in class pointless.

She's very unclear. She's not the worst, but definietly avoid if you have the chance.

Her teaching can be dry at times, but her activities are fun. Her tests and quizzes are very wordy and can be confusing. Online quizzes consists of 10 wordy questions with only 10 minutes to take it. Not an easy "A", but it's very likely if you put effort into it. Her assignments are easy A's, but there is a lot of discussions to do.

I took her for two classes. Public Speaking- Do not take her. Organizational com- she's alright. She's unclear and not very good with technology and not always that understanding. She's alright but if you have a choice pick Mass comm without her!!

She's a nice professor. The grade you get is reflected by how much effort you put in. She's definitely willing to work with you throughout the semester. She's a stickler for deadlines and rules. Hybrid class was ok, but all you'd do in class is listen to speeches which was so boring. Lectures are online. Midterm and Final.  You'll be fine.

PROS: Nice lady. CONS: She was very unclear in many of the assignments. i.e., the power point of chapter 1 was chapter 2 and so on and she never fixed. She used PANOTO which is a nightmare  most of the time you were unable to open it, - the entire class had the same issue  So, you had to expend lots time with tech support and send e-mails to her

Not a fan of her. She makes you do all kinds of activities in class and posts lectures online. She talks to you like your in elementary school and gets mad when any phones are out. Lots of assignments, discussions, and quizzes. Pretty easy class, there's just a lot of busy work.

Very nice lady. Took her for public speaking. She dealt with my continuous crap (late assignments, excuses, etc) over the semester with a positive and caring attitude. She teaches pretty much by the book and I agreed with her grading. So if you want a pleasant, traditional, no curveball teacher, she's a good pick.

Took as a hybrid.  The on-line part is a lot of work, but the work gives you a good understanding of the principles of the course, which is a good thing. She is disorganized and sometimes confusing, but she is approachable and is willing to listen or change things if needed. Class work was not helpful but mandatory. Do you work and you will be fine

I took this professor as a hybrid course for Com 2205. This was my first ever hybrid course and she made it so easy. We had 13 quizzes for the 13 chapters. She drops your lowest 3 quizzes. You are given a mid term and a final, one mini paper and presentation. She gives a lot of work for her on-line activities, do the work and your golden.
For a public speaking teacher she does not have very good speaking skills. Very unclear on instructions. Tests and quizzes are online though.

Professor Beach is such an easy professor for Interpersonal Communication - almost too easy! There is one research paper that only has to be five pages. All three of her exams (including the final) are given online, so you can take them at your convenience. Her in class assignments are very easy, but there are a lot of them so attend her class!
NO NO NO!!! She is so unorganized and will ALWAYS change what she wants turned in. I would not recommend her unless you like to just be all over the place daily.

She is very unorganized. Don't bother asking her questions about her grading because she clearly doesn't care. She doesn't proof read anything before putting it up for students to read and it can have a significant impact on your grade. She isn't specific about PowerPoint information and goes through them too quickly anyway. Avoid her if you can.
Show up, participate, do the work and you will be fine.

As a B/C student & non communication major; I learned in her class and made a B+. While attendance is mandatory, she makes it fun. If the students are interested and verbal, she is an active teacher. She is fully interested in her students and wants them to succeed.

This lady has no justification whatsoever on the way she grades. I am an all A student and no matter what I do, I constantly get B's on my speeches even though everyone else gets an A. I think she picks favorites and chooses a grade for you before you even speak. The class is so easy but she is a harsh grader and makes no sense when grading.

She is awful. The second worst teacher I've had at KSU. She is a harsh grader, never is clear in what she wants, her tests are hard. Worst of all the grades are barely about your ability to speak. This is supposed to be a public speaking class. It should be mainly about speaking.

Prof. Beach is a nice lady. This course was hybrid. Tons of online work obviously. Pretty clear on what she expects from you. WRITE DOWN YOUR NOTES FROM THE POWERPOINTS IN THE LECTURES! The midterm comes straight from those, so make sure you study them. There are 5 speeches total, pretty easy. Really helps you calm anxiety about public speaking.

This class was incredibly easy. Lots of pointless assignments though and attendance is mandatory. Also, she has a few group projects which weigh kind of heavily, which is the only thing I hated about this class. I received an 88 instead of an A in this class because of the grades received on group projects.
This teacher should be a kindergarten teacher. She designated "Quiet times" and "No talk zones." She doesn't know what she's teaching and is very unorganized. Do not take this professor at all costs.

Horrible teacher. She doesn't know what she's talking about and if you ask her a question she won't be able to answer it. Her powerpoints are useless and a waste of class time. I would never recommend this teacher, even to my worst enemy.

Treats you like a high schooler or even middle school. Doesn't like use of electronic. Has leaders to baby sit classmates and her test are hard! Overall nice lady but very boring and projects are graded hard. Has favorites in class and if you're not one you will be called out in class. If you have to take her it's not too bad

Mrs. Beach is so much like a kindergarten teacher. She is like a sweet old lady. She rambles about non-related topics. The class itself was in group forms that you don't pick yourselves, she does have tricky test questions, but now she has you take them online, you don't have class that day so that's a plus. Other then that the class itself is easy

I was miserable in her class.  She doesn't like to be bothered with your concerns or questions.  Do not expect her to be direct about instructions.  It takes her 10 minutes to decide on how to put a 20 into 4 groups.  Judging from my other classmate's grades on projects and presentations, if she likes you- your grade will be higher. You won't learn much from this class. Most classes are watching past speeches, useless exercises, or powerpoints. She is a boring teacher, but grades fair. Can be very unclear about assaignments. She is not a professor to avoid taking, but there are probably better out there for this class.

I had Mrs. Beach this past semester and she is great. There are 5 speeches and 2 Tests which are the Midterm and Final. There are no quizzes what so ever. She is the best. Seriously Listen to what I am saying. You will be video taped on 3 of the speeches and you dont have to show anyone or her. Its for evaluating yourself.TAKE HER!!!!Also show up!!
Mrs. Beach is very helpful.  I learned a lot from this class.

Prof Beach's class is pretty easy. You have 5 speeches and 2 are very detailed. You have 2 exams, a final and midterm. If you show up to class and complete your work, you will do fine. Put in effort or else she will grade you harshly. It's very easy to make an A in her class.

Don't take her, she plays favorites and grades totally irrationally. Find another professor for Pub. Speaking, this woman is ridiculous and has no reason teaching a public speaking class when she studders repeatedly while teaching. Oh, and not exciting or exhilarating at all when teaching.
She's a good teacher and gives sufficient information to succeed through the class.

She is a great teacher and the speeches you have to to are very intersting. There are 4 required speeches, none of them very long at all. You get to pick your own topics. Also, pick your group members carefully! Beach is really sweet and will always help. I learned a TON and gives you GREAT experience for working in T&D field!!

You have to keep up with your work and put some effort into the course but nothing too taxing.  If you show up with a pleasant attitude and fake a willingness to learn she will appreciate it!  The requirements are made VERY clear from the begining so if you're not up for it on syllabus day then think twice.

This women is horrible and she plays the favortism role way too much and she is bery unclear, hard for no reason, and i mean she is just bad Do not take her class you will regret every second of taking she I mean I swear she targeted certain people, and many people saw it, take Galloy for public speaking just avoid this woman.  BAD Newz!!!!!!!
I liked Mrs.Beach.  She likes to get everyone involved.  Speak up in her class. Her tests were a little hard but you also have a couple of projects to make up for test grades.

If communications is not your major, then forget this teacher. She is not understanding. She was often late. Grades extremely hard. always unorganized. Just a horrible teacher. don't let this teacher have anything to do with your gpa
Exams are not too bad, but she needs to give more material to students.  She is an average grader, and she htes technology pertaining to internet.
